basics.name: Nishitha Daryn
basics.label: Medical Electronics Engineer
basics.summary: I am a passionate and outgoing student currently pursuing my studies in Medical Electronics with a deep fascination for the convergence of technology and healthcare. My interests and efforts also lie in Data Science and Programming. I am working on innovative healthcare devices that can be used as accessible solutions for healthcare gaps in the community.

achievements.name: Winner of the Lenovo SmarterEd Scholarship Program
Award for Balanced Student
achievements.issuer: International Baccalaureate and Conselho Nacional de Educacao

work.name: The Tech Society
work.summary: Currently publishing monthly digital zines exploring the intersection of Technology and Society‚Äîcovering both technical insights and actionable tips for student growth. Planned and organized ‚ÄòThe Engineering Blueprint‚Äô, an annual career-building workshop in collaboration with IEEE, where senior peers share their journeys to guide students through academic and career development.

work.name: Tamil Nadu Centre of Excellence for Advanced Manufacturing - TANCAM
work.summary: Developed a VR Medical Anatomy Museum on Unity for immersive learning experiences. Programmed ESP32 robots controlled via a PS4 controller, and worked on a CPR training mannequin equipped with sensors to measure vital parameters.

projects.name: Patient Tracker Database
projects.description: A patient database that keeps track of patient details including name, age, gender, blood group, contact info, medical condition, allergies, assigned doctor, and room number.

projects.name: Patient Monitoring Dashboard
projects.description: A real-time patient monitoring dashboard showing ECG, blood pressure, vitals, trends, alerts on threshold breaches, upcoming appointments, and patient details. The backend can be connected to sensors with MongoDB for data storage.

projects.name: Organ Museum VR
projects.description: A virtual reality first-person walkthrough of a human organ museum built using Unity. Aimed at helping medical students learn anatomy through immersive visualization.

projects.name: Heat Sensor using LM358
projects.description:
A mini project built using LM358 op-amp, this sensor detects when temperature exceeds a set limit and triggers an output.
Medical Use: Can be a safety feature in neonatal incubators to alert when temperatures go beyond safe levels.
highlights: ‚ö†Ô∏è Triggers alert when threshold is exceeded
